data.title: The Tomb of Akbar is located in Sikandra, a suburb of Agra, Uttar Pradesh. Akbar’s son, Jahangir, commissioned the construction of the tomb...
data.meta_description:
192 likes, 2 comments - caa_aiis on May 19, 2024: "The Tomb of Akbar is located in Sikandra, a suburb of Agra, Uttar Pradesh. Akbar’s son, Jahangir, commissioned the construction of the tomb after Akbar’s death in 1605. The main tomb building is four-tiered and made of red sandstone and marble. The lower levels are made of red sandstone, while the upper levels, including the central dome, are constructed using white marble. The tomb is a blend of various architectural styles, showcasing a combination of Persian, Indian, and Islamic elements.

Documented by CA&A in September 1985 and November-December 1990

This collection was digitized through MEAP grant awarded to CA&A by the @uclalibrary 

#tombofakbar #sikandra #agra #uttarpradesh #india #jahangir #redsandstone #marblearchitecture #persianarchitecture #indianarchitecture #islamicarchitecture #historicalmonument #mughalarchitecture".
